posts.title: Three Easy Film-Inspired Halloween Costumes
posts.text: Need a last-minute costume for that Zoom Halloween party you decided to attend?

posts.title: Books & Films About the Chicano Movement And Its Contributions to American History
posts.text: Today's climate of protest, unrest, and uncertainty has people wanting to learn more about and discuss the oppression of marginalized groups and race relations in America. This is a great opportunity to extend the conversation and celebrate the many contributions and influences of El Movimiento.

posts.title: A Virtual Celebration of the West Indian American Day Parade
posts.text: While you won't be able to attend the Labor Day Parade in person this year and party with millions of spectators and participants, you can jump-start your virtual carnival by checking out the following resources.

posts.title: Is the Book or Movie Better? Try Both and Decide for Yourself
posts.text: Regardless of where you stand, here are some popular book-to-film adaptations and a couple of documentaries you can read and /or stream using your library card.

posts.title: Poems of Protest by Black LGBTQ Poets
posts.text: All of these poetry collections are also available as digital e-books.

posts.title: Beauty & Skincare Books That Utilize Your Pantry
posts.text: Let your inner DIYer out to play to ensure that you are taking care of your mind, body, and soul.

posts.title: Get Inspired: Tiny House E-Books for the Novice
posts.text: Great resources for architectural design, interior design, green alternatives, and an off-grid lifestyle.
